July 2001 was the seventh month of that common year. The month, which began on a Sunday, ended on a Tuesday after 31 days.

Portal:Current events[edit]

This is an archived version of Wikipedia's Current events Portal from July 2001.

Current events of July 1, 2001 (2001-07-01) (Sunday) edit history watch
  • Aliso Viejo officially becomes the 34th city in Orange County, California.
  • Alliant International University is formed.
Current events of July 2, 2001 (2001-07-02) (Monday) edit history watch
  • The world's first self-contained artificial heart is implanted in Robert Tools.
Current events of July 3, 2001 (2001-07-03) (Tuesday) edit history watch
  • A Vladivostokavia Tupolev Tu-154 jetliner crashes on approach to landing at Irkutsk, Russia, killing 145.
Current events of July 4, 2001 (2001-07-04) (Wednesday) edit history watch
  • The film Cats & Dogs is released.
Current events of July 6, 2001 (2001-07-06) (Friday) edit history watch
  • The film Kiss of the Dragon is released.
Current events of July 7, 2001 (2001-07-07) (Saturday) edit history watch
  • The Bradford riots take place in Manningham, Bradford, UK, after clashes in the city centre between National Front members and members of the local Asian community.
  • Dale Earnhardt Jr. wins the Pepsi 400 in the first NASCAR Winston Cup Series race at the Daytona International Speedway since the death of Dale Earnhardt. Teammate Michael Waltrip ran second, blocking for Jr., an exact mirror of the Daytona 500 where Jr. blocked for Waltrip en route to his first 500 win.
Current events of July 9, 2001 (2001-07-09) (Monday) edit history watch
  • Goran Ivanišević won Wimbledon tennis tournament and became the first, and so far the last, wildcard to achieve that accord.
Current events of July 13, 2001 (2001-07-13) (Friday) edit history watch
  • The International Olympic Committee session in Moscow, Russia. Beijing wins the bid as the host city for the 2008 Summer Olympics.
Current events of July 18, 2001 (2001-07-18) (Wednesday) edit history watch
  • In Baltimore, Maryland, a 60-car train derailment occurs in a tunnel sparking a fire that will last days and virtually shut down downtown Baltimore (see Howard Street Tunnel fire).
Current events of July 19, 2001 (2001-07-19) (Thursday) edit history watch
  • UK politician and novelist Jeffrey Archer, sentenced to four years in prison for perjury and perverting the course of justice.
Current events of July 20, 2001 (2001-07-20) (Friday) edit history watch
  • Vanessa Leggett is found in contempt by a Federal Court for refusing to release notes made for her book on the Doris Angleton murder.
  • The 27th G8 summit takes place in Genoa, Italy until July 22nd. Massive demonstrations against the meeting by anti-globalisation groups. One demonstrator, Carlo Giuliani, is shot dead by a carabiniere and several others are badly injured during an attack by the police on a school which the protesters were using as their headquarters.
Current events of July 21, 2001 (2001-07-21) (Saturday) edit history watch
  • Akashi pedestrian bridge accident: At the conclusion of a fireworks display on Okura Beach in Akashi, Hyōgo, Japan, 11 people are killed and more than 120 are injured when a pedestrian footbridge connecting the beach to JR Asagiri railway station becomes overcrowded and people leaving the event fall down in a domino effect.
Current events of July 23, 2001 (2001-07-23) (Monday) edit history watch
  • Honduras defeats Brazil in a soccer match by final result of 2–0.
  • Died: Eudora Welty
Current events of July 26, 2001 (2001-07-26) (Thursday) edit history watch
  • The republic of Moldova becomes a member of the World Trade Organization.
Current events of July 27, 2001 (2001-07-27) (Friday) edit history watch
  • The film Planet of the Apes is released.
Current events of July 28, 2001 (2001-07-28) (Saturday) edit history watch
  • Alejandro Toledo is sworn as the new president of Peru, eight months after the vote of no-confidence of former President Alberto Fujimori.
Current events of July 31, 2001 (2001-07-31) (Tuesday) edit history watch
  • Died: Poul Anderson
◀July 2001▶
